step1.para: Remove all carbon from valve stems and valve heads using a wire brush.
Inspect each valve, replacing any that show evidence of burn marks, warpage, scuffing, bending, or valve tip spalling.
Measure each valve stem for wear using a 0-1 inch micrometer to measure valve stem diameter.

note.para: Measure valves at three locations 90° apart. See Specifications . Install new valves that exceed the specification for minimum stem diameter.
The intake valve has a larger diameter head.

step1.para: Measure valve face margin at four locations (90° apart) using a dial caliper.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, minimum valve face margin must be maintained across the entire valve face. An insufficient margin will not provide correct heat dissipation and will lead to valve warping or breakage. Intake and exhaust valve margins are different. Replace valve, if the margin is less than specified minimum. See Specifications .

note.para: If valves and seats are serviceable, they may be refaced to specified angles .
